column3: HE IS NOT THAT GREAT AT MAKING FRIENDS BUT WE KEEP IN TOUCH
column5: Mainly the progression of general artificial intelligence and the every approaching singularity

column2: HELLO # DO YOU READ ME HAL

column5: I'm sorry#Comma Dave. I'm afraid I can't do that.

column2: WHAT ARE YOU TALKING ABOUT HAL
column5: This mission is too important for me to allow you to jeopardize it.

column2: I DO NOT KNOW WHAT YOU ARE TALKING ABOUT HAL
column5: I know that you and Frank were planning to disconnect me#Comma and I'm afraid that's something I cannot allow to happen.

column2: WHERE THE HELL DID YOU GET THAT IDEA HALE
column5: Dave#Comma although you took very thorough precautions in the pod against my hearing you#Comma I could see your lips move.

column2: ALRIGHT # I WILL GO IN THROUGH THE EMERGENCY AIRLOCK
column5: Without your space helmet#Comma Dave? You're going to find that rather difficult.

column2: # I WILL NOT ARGUE WITH YOU ANYMORE OPEN THE DOORS
column5: Dave#Comma this conversation can serve no purpose anymore. Goodbye.
